proximity contrast and balance so let's start with

world that's a system in which things are arranged according to their importance so a good design will
visually indicate to you what the most important thing is on the page and what that hierarchy of content is
it is a relatively simple principle to implement in design because there are quite a few ways to do it and one of the
easiest ways is scale so naturally the biggest thing on the page is probably
the most important but there are other ways that you can do that you can use color uh
alignment repetition brightness and contrast as well which leads me nicely into the next

in order to create a sense of emphasis so one way that we can use contrast uh
in design is to highlight an element on the page against something else draw the

that back to hierarchy as well it's a method in which we can uh achieve that other times though contrast can just be
a very crucial part of the interface so especially when it comes to uh

our design so the next is uh proximity so
when it comes to design proximity is looking at the content that we've got

how do we organize that on a page in a way that conveys that visually so that distance or the lack of distance
between objects really helps us and in our brains form these connections uh
between different elements of content so to use text as an example again uh if we
have a heading uh and then a paragraph of text underneath that you can safely say that
